name: Newborough Beach (Llanddwyn)
description: Vast beach with views to Snowdonia. Llanddwyn Island at south end is magical. Romantic legend and lighthouse ruins. Allow whole day.

name: Rhosneigr (Traeth Crigyll)
description: A mecca for watersports enthusiasts, Rhosneigr offers wide sands and reliable wind.

name: Trearddur Bay
description: Popular family beach with a promenade, rock pools, and protected bathing area.

name: Benllech
description: Wide, safe, sandy beach perfect for families, with easy access and plenty of facilities.

name: Red Wharf Bay (Traeth Coch)
description: A vast expanse of sand at low tide, famous for its beauty and the Ship Inn nearby.

name: Church Bay (Porth Swtan)
description: Rugged and beautiful cove with high cliffs, excellent rock pools and a famous seafood restaurant.

name: Cable Bay (Porth Trecastell)
description: Small, sheltered bay popular with surfers and kayakers, backed by dunes and cliffs.

name: Lligwy Beach
description: Wide, open sandy beach with shallow water, great for families and watersports.

name: Aberffraw (Traeth Mawr)
description: Unspoilt sandy beach backed by extensive dunes, requiring a walk from the village.

name: Porth Dafarch
description: Sheltered sandy cove owned by the National Trust, popular for scuba diving and kayaking.

name: Cemaes Bay (Traeth Mawr)
description: Pretty harbour village with two sandy beaches, sheltered and safe for families.

name: Traeth Llydan (Broad Beach)
description: Quieter alternative to Rhosneigr's main beach, offering miles of sand and good surf.
